segment.source: Deploy Required Features for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Deploy Required Features for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Deploy Required Features for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Deploy Required Features for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Deploy Required Features for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Deploy Required Features for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: All Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, and 2.1 SP1 deployments require these features
segment.target: All Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, and 2.1 SP1 deployments require these features

segment.source: Deploy a Settings Storage Location that is accessible to end users.
segment.target: Deploy a Settings Storage Location that is accessible to end users.

segment.source: This is a standard network share that stores and retrieves user settings.
segment.target: This is a standard network share that stores and retrieves user settings.

segment.source: Choose the Configuration Method for UE-V
segment.target: Choose the Configuration Method for UE-V

segment.source: UE-V can be deployed and configured using common management tools including group policy, Configuration Manager, or Windows Management Infrastructure and Powershell.
segment.target: UE-V can be deployed and configured using common management tools including group policy, Configuration Manager, or Windows Management Infrastructure and Powershell.

segment.source: Deploy a UE-V Agent to be installed on every computer that synchronizes settings.
segment.target: Deploy a UE-V Agent to be installed on every computer that synchronizes settings.

segment.source: This monitors registered applications and the operating system for any settings changes and synchronizes those settings between computers.
segment.target: This monitors registered applications and the operating system for any settings changes and synchronizes those settings between computers.

segment.source: The topics in this section describe how to deploy these features.
segment.target: The topics in this section describe how to deploy these features.

segment.source: Deploy a UE-V Settings Storage Location
segment.target: Deploy a UE-V Settings Storage Location

segment.source: UE-V requires a location in which to store user settings in settings package files.
segment.target: UE-V requires a location in which to store user settings in settings package files.

segment.source: You can configure this settings storage location in one of these ways:
segment.target: You can configure this settings storage location in one of these ways:

segment.source: Create your own settings storage location
segment.target: Create your own settings storage location

segment.source: Use existing Active Directory for your settings storage location
segment.target: Use existing Active Directory for your settings storage location

segment.source: If you don’t create a settings storage location, the UE-V Agent will use Active Directory (AD) by default.
segment.target: If you don’t create a settings storage location, the UE-V Agent will use Active Directory (AD) by default.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: As a matter of performance and capacity planning and to reduce problems with network latency, create settings storage locations on the same local networks where the users’ computers reside.
segment.target: As a matter of performance and capacity planning and to reduce problems with network latency, create settings storage locations on the same local networks where the users’ computers reside.

segment.source: We recommend 20 MB of disk space per user for the settings storage location.
segment.target: We recommend 20 MB of disk space per user for the settings storage location.

segment.source: Create a UE-V Settings Storage Location
segment.target: Create a UE-V Settings Storage Location

segment.source: Before you define the settings storage location, you must create a root directory with read/write permissions for users who store settings on the share.
segment.target: Before you define the settings storage location, you must create a root directory with read/write permissions for users who store settings on the share.

segment.source: The UE-V Agent creates user-specific folders under this root directory.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent creates user-specific folders under this root directory.

segment.source: The settings storage location is defined by setting the SettingsStoragePath configuration option, which you can configure by using one of these methods:
segment.target: The settings storage location is defined by setting the SettingsStoragePath configuration option, which you can configure by using one of these methods:

segment.source: When you Deploy the UE-V Agent through a command-line parameter or in a batch script
segment.target: When you Deploy the UE-V Agent through a command-line parameter or in a batch script

segment.source: Through Group Policy settings
segment.target: Through Group Policy settings

segment.source: With the System Center Configuration Pack for UE-V
segment.target: With the System Center Configuration Pack for UE-V

segment.source: After installation of the UE-V Agent, by using Windows PowerShell or Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI)
segment.target: After installation of the UE-V Agent, by using Windows PowerShell or Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI)

segment.source: The path must be in a universal naming convention (UNC) path of the server and share.
segment.target: The path must be in a universal naming convention (UNC) path of the server and share.

segment.source: For example, ServerSettingsshare.
segment.target: For example, ServerSettingsshare.

segment.source: This configuration option supports the use of variables to enable specific synchronization scenarios.
segment.target: This configuration option supports the use of variables to enable specific synchronization scenarios.

segment.source: For example, you can use the variables to preserve the end user settings experience in these scenarios:
segment.target: For example, you can use the variables to preserve the end user settings experience in these scenarios:

segment.source: End users that use multiple physical computers in your enterprise
segment.target: End users that use multiple physical computers in your enterprise

segment.source: Enterprise computers that are used by multiple end users
segment.target: Enterprise computers that are used by multiple end users

segment.source: The UE-V Agent dynamically creates a user-specific settings storage path, with a hidden system folder named , based on the configuration setting of SettingsStoragePath.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent dynamically creates a user-specific settings storage path, with a hidden system folder named , based on the configuration setting of SettingsStoragePath.

segment.source: The agent reads and writes settings to this location as defined by the registered UE-V settings location templates.
segment.target: The agent reads and writes settings to this location as defined by the registered UE-V settings location templates.

segment.source: UE-V settings are determined by a "Last write wins" rule: If the settings storage location is the same for user with multiple managed computers, one UE-V Agent reads and writes to the settings location independently of agents running on other computers.
segment.target: UE-V settings are determined by a "Last write wins" rule: If the settings storage location is the same for user with multiple managed computers, one UE-V Agent reads and writes to the settings location independently of agents running on other computers.

segment.source: The last written settings and values are the ones applied when the next agent reads from the settings storage location.
segment.target: The last written settings and values are the ones applied when the next agent reads from the settings storage location.

segment.source: Deploy the settings storage location: Follow these steps to define the settings storage location rather than using your existing Active Directory service.
segment.target: Deploy the settings storage location: Follow these steps to define the settings storage location rather than using your existing Active Directory service.

segment.source: You should limit access to the settings storage share to those users that require it, as shown in the tables below.
segment.target: You should limit access to the settings storage share to those users that require it, as shown in the tables below.

segment.source: To deploy the UE-V network share
segment.target: To deploy the UE-V network share

segment.source: Create a new security group for UE-V users.
segment.target: Create a new security group for UE-V users.

segment.source: Create a new folder on the centrally located computer that stores the UE-V settings packages, and then grant the UE-V users access with group permissions to the folder.
segment.target: Create a new folder on the centrally located computer that stores the UE-V settings packages, and then grant the UE-V users access with group permissions to the folder.

segment.source: The administrator who supports UE-V must have permissions to this shared folder.
segment.target: The administrator who supports UE-V must have permissions to this shared folder.

segment.source: Set the following share-level Server Message Block (SMB) permissions for the settings storage location folder.
segment.target: Set the following share-level Server Message Block (SMB) permissions for the settings storage location folder.

segment.source: User account
segment.target: User account

segment.source: Recommended permissions
segment.target: Recommended permissions

segment.source: Everyone
segment.target: Everyone

segment.source: No permissions
segment.target: No permissions

segment.source: Security group of UE-V users
segment.target: Security group of UE-V users

segment.source: Full control
segment.target: Full control

segment.source: Set the following NTFS file system permissions for the settings storage location folder.
segment.target: Set the following NTFS file system permissions for the settings storage location folder.

segment.source: User account
segment.target: User account

segment.source: Recommended permissions
segment.target: Recommended permissions

segment.source: Folder
segment.target: Folder

segment.source: Creator/owner
segment.target: Creator/owner

segment.source: Full control
segment.target: Full control

segment.source: Subfolders and files only
segment.target: Subfolders and files only

segment.source: Security group of UE-V users
segment.target: Security group of UE-V users

segment.source: List folder/read data, create folders/append data
segment.target: List folder/read data, create folders/append data

segment.source: This folder only
segment.target: This folder only

segment.source: With this configuration, the UE-V Agent creates and secures a Settingspackage folder while it runs in the context of the user, and grants each user permission to create folders for settings storage.
segment.target: With this configuration, the UE-V Agent creates and secures a Settingspackage folder while it runs in the context of the user, and grants each user permission to create folders for settings storage.

segment.source: Users receive full control to their Settingspackage folder while other users cannot access it.
segment.target: Users receive full control to their Settingspackage folder while other users cannot access it.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you create the settings storage share on a computer running a Windows Server operating system, configure UE-V to verify that either the local Administrators group or the current user is the owner of the folder where settings packages are stored.
segment.target: If you create the settings storage share on a computer running a Windows Server operating system, configure UE-V to verify that either the local Administrators group or the current user is the owner of the folder where settings packages are stored.

segment.source: To enable this additional security, specify this setting in the Windows Server Registry Editor:
segment.target: To enable this additional security, specify this setting in the Windows Server Registry Editor:

segment.source: Add a REGDWORD registry key named "RepositoryOwnerCheckEnabled" to HKEYLOCALMACHINESoftwareMicrosoftUEVAgentConfiguration.
segment.target: Add a REGDWORD registry key named "RepositoryOwnerCheckEnabled" to HKEYLOCALMACHINESoftwareMicrosoftUEVAgentConfiguration.

segment.source: Set the registry key value to 1.
segment.target: Set the registry key value to 1.

segment.source: Use Active Directory with UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Use Active Directory with UE-V 2.x

segment.source: The UE-V Agent uses Active Directory (AD) by default if a settings storage location is not otherwise defined.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent uses Active Directory (AD) by default if a settings storage location is not otherwise defined.

segment.source: In these cases, the UE-V Agent dynamically creates the settings storage folder under the root of the AD home directory of each user.
segment.target: In these cases, the UE-V Agent dynamically creates the settings storage folder under the root of the AD home directory of each user.

segment.source: But, if a custom directory setting is configured in AD, then that directory is used instead.
segment.target: But, if a custom directory setting is configured in AD, then that directory is used instead.

segment.source: Choose the Configuration Method for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Choose the Configuration Method for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: You want to figure out which configuration method you'll use to manage UE-V after deployment since this will be the configuration method you use to deploy the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: You want to figure out which configuration method you'll use to manage UE-V after deployment since this will be the configuration method you use to deploy the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: Typically, this is the configuration method that you already use in your environment, such as Windows PowerShell or Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Typically, this is the configuration method that you already use in your environment, such as Windows PowerShell or Configuration Manager.

segment.source: You can configure UE-V before, during, or after UE-V Agent installation, depending on the configuration method that you use.
segment.target: You can configure UE-V before, during, or after UE-V Agent installation, depending on the configuration method that you use.

segment.source: Group Policy : You can use your existing Group Policy infrastructure to configure UE-V before or after UE-V Agent deployment.
segment.target: Group Policy : You can use your existing Group Policy infrastructure to configure UE-V before or after UE-V Agent deployment.

segment.source: The UE-V Group Policy ADMX template enables the central management of common UE-V Agent configuration options, and it includes settings to configure UE-V synchronization.
segment.target: The UE-V Group Policy ADMX template enables the central management of common UE-V Agent configuration options, and it includes settings to configure UE-V synchronization.

segment.source: Installing the UE-V Group Policy ADMX Templates: Group Policy ADMX templates for UE-V configure the synchronization settings for the UE-V Agent and enable the central management of common UE-V Agent configuration settings by using an existing Group Policy infrastructure.
segment.target: Installing the UE-V Group Policy ADMX Templates: Group Policy ADMX templates for UE-V configure the synchronization settings for the UE-V Agent and enable the central management of common UE-V Agent configuration settings by using an existing Group Policy infrastructure.

segment.source: Supported operating systems for the domain controller that deploys the Group Policy Objects include the following:
segment.target: Supported operating systems for the domain controller that deploys the Group Policy Objects include the following:

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Configuration Manager : The UE-V Configuration Pack lets you use the Compliance Settings feature of System Center Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 or later to apply consistent configurations across sites where UE-V and Configuration Manager are installed.
segment.target: Configuration Manager : The UE-V Configuration Pack lets you use the Compliance Settings feature of System Center Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 or later to apply consistent configurations across sites where UE-V and Configuration Manager are installed.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell and WMI : You can use scripted commands for Windows PowerShell and Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to modify configurations after you install the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: Windows PowerShell and WMI : You can use scripted commands for Windows PowerShell and Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to modify configurations after you install the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Registry modification can result in data loss, or the computer becomes unresponsive.
segment.target: Registry modification can result in data loss, or the computer becomes unresponsive.

segment.source: We recommend that you use other configuration methods.
segment.target: We recommend that you use other configuration methods.

segment.source: Command-line or Batch Script Installation: Parameters that are used when you Deploy the UE-V Agent configure many UE-V settings.
segment.target: Command-line or Batch Script Installation: Parameters that are used when you Deploy the UE-V Agent configure many UE-V settings.

segment.source: Electronic software distribution systems, such as System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, use these parameters to configure their clients when they deploy and install the UE-V Agent software.
segment.target: Electronic software distribution systems, such as System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, use these parameters to configure their clients when they deploy and install the UE-V Agent software.

segment.source: Deploy the UE-V 2.x Agent
segment.target: Deploy the UE-V 2.x Agent

segment.source: The UE-V Agent is the core of a UE-V deployment and must run on each computer that uses UE-V to synchronize application and Windows settings.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent is the core of a UE-V deployment and must run on each computer that uses UE-V to synchronize application and Windows settings.

segment.source: UE-V Agent Installation Files: A single installation file, AgentSetup.exe, installs the UE-V Agent on both 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems.
segment.target: UE-V Agent Installation Files: A single installation file, AgentSetup.exe, installs the UE-V Agent on both 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems.

segment.source: In addition, AgentSetupx86.msi or AgentSetupx64.msi architecture-specific Windows Installer files are provided, and since they are smaller, they might streamline the agent deployments.
segment.target: In addition, AgentSetupx86.msi or AgentSetupx64.msi architecture-specific Windows Installer files are provided, and since they are smaller, they might streamline the agent deployments.

segment.source: The command-line parameters for the AgentSetup.exe installer are supported for the Windows Installer installation as well.
segment.target: The command-line parameters for the AgentSetup.exe installer are supported for the Windows Installer installation as well.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: During UE-V Agent installation or uninstallation, you can either use the AgentSetup.exe file or the AgentSetuparch.msi file, but not both.
segment.target: During UE-V Agent installation or uninstallation, you can either use the AgentSetup.exe file or the AgentSetuparch.msi file, but not both.

segment.source: The same file must be used to uninstall the UE-V Agent that was used to install the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: The same file must be used to uninstall the UE-V Agent that was used to install the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: To Deploy the UE-V Agent
segment.target: To Deploy the UE-V Agent

segment.source: You can use the following methods to deploy the UE-V Agent:
segment.target: You can use the following methods to deploy the UE-V Agent:

segment.source: An electronic software distribution (ESD) solution system, such as Configuration Manager, that can install a Windows Installer (.msi) file.
segment.target: An electronic software distribution (ESD) solution system, such as Configuration Manager, that can install a Windows Installer (.msi) file.

segment.source: An installation script that references the Windows Installer (.msi) file that is stored centrally on a share.
segment.target: An installation script that references the Windows Installer (.msi) file that is stored centrally on a share.

segment.source: An installation program that you run manually on the computer.
segment.target: An installation program that you run manually on the computer.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to deploy the UE-V Agent from a network share.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to deploy the UE-V Agent from a network share.

segment.source: To install and configure the UE-V Agent from a network share
segment.target: To install and configure the UE-V Agent from a network share

segment.source: Stage the UE-V Agent installation file AgentSetup.exe on a network share to which users have Read permission.
segment.target: Stage the UE-V Agent installation file AgentSetup.exe on a network share to which users have Read permission.

segment.source: Deploy a script to user computers that installs the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: Deploy a script to user computers that installs the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: The script should specify the settings storage location.
segment.target: The script should specify the settings storage location.

segment.source: Deployment options: Be sure to use the correct variable format when you install the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: Deployment options: Be sure to use the correct variable format when you install the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: The following table provides examples of deployment options for using the AgentSetup.exe or the Windows Installer (.msi) files.
segment.target: The following table provides examples of deployment options for using the AgentSetup.exe or the Windows Installer (.msi) files.

segment.source: Deployment type
segment.target: Deployment type

segment.source: Deployment description
segment.target: Deployment description

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: Command prompt
segment.target: Command prompt

segment.source: When you install the UE-V Agent at a command prompt, use the %^username% variable format.
segment.target: When you install the UE-V Agent at a command prompt, use the %^username% variable format.

segment.source: If quotation marks are required because of spaces in the settings storage path, use a batch script file for deployment.
segment.target: If quotation marks are required because of spaces in the settings storage path, use a batch script file for deployment.

segment.source: Batch script
segment.target: Batch script

segment.source: When you install the UE-V Agent from a batch script file, use the %%username%% variable format.
segment.target: When you install the UE-V Agent from a batch script file, use the %%username%% variable format.

segment.source: If you use this installation method, you must escape the variable with the %% characters.
segment.target: If you use this installation method, you must escape the variable with the %% characters.

segment.source: Without this character, the script expands the username variable at installation time, rather than at run time, which causes UE-V to use a single settings storage location for all users.
segment.target: Without this character, the script expands the username variable at installation time, rather than at run time, which causes UE-V to use a single settings storage location for all users.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Windows PowerShell

segment.source: When you install the UE-V Agent from a Windows PowerShell prompt or a Windows PowerShell script, use the %username% variable format.
segment.target: When you install the UE-V Agent from a Windows PowerShell prompt or a Windows PowerShell script, use the %username% variable format.

segment.source: Electronic software distribution, such as deployment of Configuration Manager Software Deployment
segment.target: Electronic software distribution, such as deployment of Configuration Manager Software Deployment

segment.source: When you install the UE-V Agent by using Configuration Manager, use the ^%username^% variable format.
segment.target: When you install the UE-V Agent by using Configuration Manager, use the ^%username^% variable format.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The installation of the UE-V Agent requires administrator rights, and the computer requires a restart before the UE-V Agent can run.
segment.target: The installation of the UE-V Agent requires administrator rights, and the computer requires a restart before the UE-V Agent can run.

segment.source: Command-line parameters for UE-V Agent deployment
segment.target: Command-line parameters for UE-V Agent deployment

segment.source: The command-line parameters of the UE-V Agent are as follows.
segment.target: The command-line parameters of the UE-V Agent are as follows.

segment.source: Command-line parameter
segment.target: Command-line parameter

segment.source: Definition
segment.target: Definition

segment.source: Notes
segment.target: Notes

segment.source: /help or /h or /?
segment.target: /help or /h or /?

segment.source: Displays the AgentSetup.exe usage dialog box.
segment.target: Displays the AgentSetup.exe usage dialog box.

segment.source: SettingsStoragePath
segment.target: SettingsStoragePath

segment.source: Indicates the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines where settings are stored.
segment.target: Indicates the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines where settings are stored.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You must specify a SettingsStoragePath in UE-V 2.1 and UE-V 2.1 SP1.
segment.target: You must specify a SettingsStoragePath in UE-V 2.1 and UE-V 2.1 SP1.

segment.source: You can set the AdHomePath string to specify that the user's Active Directory home path is used.
segment.target: You can set the AdHomePath string to specify that the user's Active Directory home path is used.

segment.source: For example, .
segment.target: For example, .

segment.source: In UE-V 2.0, you can leave SettingsStoragePath blank to use the Active Directory home path instead.
segment.target: In UE-V 2.0, you can leave SettingsStoragePath blank to use the Active Directory home path instead.

segment.source: %username% or %computername% environment variables are accepted.
segment.target: %username% or %computername% environment variables are accepted.

segment.source: Scripting can require escaped variables.
segment.target: Scripting can require escaped variables.

segment.source: Default: none
segment.target: Default: none

segment.source: SettingsStoragePathReg
segment.target: SettingsStoragePathReg

segment.source: Gets the SettingsStoragePath value from the registry during installation.
segment.target: Gets the SettingsStoragePath value from the registry during installation.

segment.source: At the command prompt, type the following example to force UE-V to use the Active Directory home path instead of a specific UNC.
segment.target: At the command prompt, type the following example to force UE-V to use the Active Directory home path instead of a specific UNC.

segment.source: SettingsTemplateCatalogPath
segment.target: SettingsTemplateCatalogPath

segment.source: Indicates the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines the location that was checked for new settings location templates.
segment.target: Indicates the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines the location that was checked for new settings location templates.

segment.source: Only required for custom settings location templates
segment.target: Only required for custom settings location templates

segment.source: RegisterMSTemplates
segment.target: RegisterMSTemplates

segment.source: Specifies whether the default Microsoft templates should be registered during installation.
segment.target: Specifies whether the default Microsoft templates should be registered during installation.

segment.source: True | False
segment.target: True | False

segment.source: Default: True
segment.target: Default: True

segment.source: SyncMethod
segment.target: SyncMethod

segment.source: Specifies which synchronization method should be used.
segment.target: Specifies which synchronization method should be used.

segment.source: SyncProvider | None
segment.target: SyncProvider | None

segment.source: Default: SyncProvider
segment.target: Default: SyncProvider

segment.source: SyncTimeoutInMilliseconds
segment.target: SyncTimeoutInMilliseconds

segment.source: Specifies the number of milliseconds that the computer waits before time-out when it retrieves user settings from the settings storage location.
segment.target: Specifies the number of milliseconds that the computer waits before time-out when it retrieves user settings from the settings storage location.

segment.source: Default: 2000 milliseconds
segment.target: Default: 2000 milliseconds

segment.source: (wait up to 2 seconds)
segment.target: (wait up to 2 seconds)

segment.source: SyncEnabled
segment.target: SyncEnabled

segment.source: Specifies whether UE-V synchronization is enabled or disabled.
segment.target: Specifies whether UE-V synchronization is enabled or disabled.

segment.source: True | False
segment.target: True | False

segment.source: Default: True
segment.target: Default: True

segment.source: MaxPackageSizeInBytes
segment.target: MaxPackageSizeInBytes

segment.source: Specifies a settings package file size in bytes when the UE-V Agent reports that files exceed the threshold.
segment.target: Specifies a settings package file size in bytes when the UE-V Agent reports that files exceed the threshold.

segment.source: size
segment.target: size

segment.source: Default: none (no warning threshold)
segment.target: Default: none (no warning threshold)

segment.source: CEIPEnabled
segment.target: CEIPEnabled

segment.source: Specifies the setting for participation in the Customer Experience Improvement program.
segment.target: Specifies the setting for participation in the Customer Experience Improvement program.

segment.source: If set to True, installer information is uploaded to the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program site.
segment.target: If set to True, installer information is uploaded to the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program site.

segment.source: If set to False, no information is uploaded.
segment.target: If set to False, no information is uploaded.

segment.source: True | False
segment.target: True | False

segment.source: Default: False
segment.target: Default: False

segment.source: NoRestart
segment.target: NoRestart

segment.source: Supports deferral of the restart of the computer after the UE-V Agent is installed.
segment.target: Supports deferral of the restart of the computer after the UE-V Agent is installed.

segment.source: INSTALLFOLDER
segment.target: INSTALLFOLDER

segment.source: Enables a different installation folder to be set for the UE-V Agent or UE-V Generator.
segment.target: Enables a different installation folder to be set for the UE-V Agent or UE-V Generator.

segment.source: MUENABLED
segment.target: MUENABLED

segment.source: Enables Setup to accept the option to be included in the Microsoft Update program.
segment.target: Enables Setup to accept the option to be included in the Microsoft Update program.

segment.source: ACCEPTLICENSETERMS
segment.target: ACCEPTLICENSETERMS

segment.source: Lets UE-V be installed silently.
segment.target: Lets UE-V be installed silently.

segment.source: This must be set to True to install UE-V silently and bypass the requirement that the user accepts the UE-V license terms.
segment.target: This must be set to True to install UE-V silently and bypass the requirement that the user accepts the UE-V license terms.

segment.source: If set to False or left empty, the user receives an error message and UE-V is not installed.
segment.target: If set to False or left empty, the user receives an error message and UE-V is not installed.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: This parameter is required to install UE-V silently.
segment.target: This parameter is required to install UE-V silently.

segment.source: NORESTART
segment.target: NORESTART

segment.source: Prevents a mandatory restart after the UE-V Agent is installed.
segment.target: Prevents a mandatory restart after the UE-V Agent is installed.

segment.source: Update the UE-V Agent
segment.target: Update the UE-V Agent

segment.source: Updates for the UE-V Agent software are provided through Microsoft Update.
segment.target: Updates for the UE-V Agent software are provided through Microsoft Update.

segment.source: You can deploy UE-V Agent updates by using Enterprise Software Distribution (ESD) infrastructure systems.
segment.target: You can deploy UE-V Agent updates by using Enterprise Software Distribution (ESD) infrastructure systems.

segment.source: During a UE-V Agent upgrade, the default group of settings location templates for common Microsoft applications and Windows settings can be updated.
segment.target: During a UE-V Agent upgrade, the default group of settings location templates for common Microsoft applications and Windows settings can be updated.

segment.source: Upgrade the UE-V 2.x Agent
segment.target: Upgrade the UE-V 2.x Agent

segment.source: The UE-V 2.x Agent introduces many new features and modifies how and when the agent uploads content to the settings storage share.
segment.target: The UE-V 2.x Agent introduces many new features and modifies how and when the agent uploads content to the settings storage share.

segment.source: The upgrade process automates these changes.
segment.target: The upgrade process automates these changes.

segment.source: To upgrade the UE-V Agent, run the UE-V Agent install package (AgentSetup.exe, AgentSetupx86.msi, or AgentSetupx64.msi) on users’ computers.
segment.target: To upgrade the UE-V Agent, run the UE-V Agent install package (AgentSetup.exe, AgentSetupx86.msi, or AgentSetupx64.msi) on users’ computers.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When you upgrade the UE-V Agent, you must use the same installer type (.exe file or .msi packet) that installed the previous UE-V Agent.
segment.target: When you upgrade the UE-V Agent, you must use the same installer type (.exe file or .msi packet) that installed the previous UE-V Agent.

segment.source: For example, use the UE-V 2 AgentSetup.exe to upgrade UE-V 1.0 Agents that were installed by using AgentSetup.exe.
segment.target: For example, use the UE-V 2 AgentSetup.exe to upgrade UE-V 1.0 Agents that were installed by using AgentSetup.exe.

segment.source: The following configurations are preserved when the Agent Setup program runs:
segment.target: The following configurations are preserved when the Agent Setup program runs:

segment.source: Settings storage path
segment.target: Settings storage path

segment.source: Registry settings
segment.target: Registry settings

segment.source: Scheduled tasks (Interval settings are reset to their defaults)
segment.target: Scheduled tasks (Interval settings are reset to their defaults)

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A computer with UE-V 2.x settings location templates that are registered in the UE-V 1.0 Agent register errors in the Windows Event Log.
segment.target: A computer with UE-V 2.x settings location templates that are registered in the UE-V 1.0 Agent register errors in the Windows Event Log.

segment.source: You can use Microsoft System Center 2012 Configuration Manager or another enterprise software distribution tool to automate and distribute the UE-V Agent upgrade.
segment.target: You can use Microsoft System Center 2012 Configuration Manager or another enterprise software distribution tool to automate and distribute the UE-V Agent upgrade.

segment.source: Recommendations: We recommend that you upgrade all of the UE-V 1.0 Agents in a computing environment, but it is not required.
segment.target: Recommendations: We recommend that you upgrade all of the UE-V 1.0 Agents in a computing environment, but it is not required.

segment.source: UE-V 2.x settings location templates can interact with a UE-V 1.0 Agent because they only share the settings from the settings storage path.
segment.target: UE-V 2.x settings location templates can interact with a UE-V 1.0 Agent because they only share the settings from the settings storage path.

segment.source: We recommend, however, that you move the deployments to a single agent version to simplify management and to support UE-V.
segment.target: We recommend, however, that you move the deployments to a single agent version to simplify management and to support UE-V.

segment.source: Repair the UE-V Agent after an unsuccessful upgrade
segment.target: Repair the UE-V Agent after an unsuccessful upgrade

segment.source: You might experience errors after you attempt one of the following operations:
segment.target: You might experience errors after you attempt one of the following operations:

segment.source: Upgrade from UE-V 1.0 to UE-V 2
segment.target: Upgrade from UE-V 1.0 to UE-V 2

segment.source: Upgrade to a newer version of Windows, for example, from Windows 7 to Windows 8 or from Windows 8 to Windows 8.1.
segment.target: Upgrade to a newer version of Windows, for example, from Windows 7 to Windows 8 or from Windows 8 to Windows 8.1.

segment.source: Uninstall the agent after upgrading the UE-V Agent
segment.target: Uninstall the agent after upgrading the UE-V Agent

segment.source: To resolve any issues, attempt to repair the UE-V Agent by entering this command at a command prompt on the computer where the agent is installed.
segment.target: To resolve any issues, attempt to repair the UE-V Agent by entering this command at a command prompt on the computer where the agent is installed.

segment.source: You can then retry the uninstall process or upgrade by installing the newer version of the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: You can then retry the uninstall process or upgrade by installing the newer version of the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for UE-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for UE-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment
